author: sky.cactus
content: The gist, as I understand it, is that you encrypt something with a key that is not yet known but will eventually be known.

author: sky.cactus
content: However, I'm quite confident the cryptography here is beyond me, it feels like it is in the realm of zkSNARK stuff (which is also beyond me).

author: sky.cactus
content: You are basically saying, "I want to encrypt this thing with the key that is returned by this function" where "this function" is something that hasn't been executed yet (and in this case, may take a very long time to execute).

author: sky.cactus
content: One can imagine a very weak similarity here to public key cryptography, where you are encrypting something with the public key.  In that case, the public key is the returned value from "the function" so definitely not a perfect analogy, but we can see how one can imagine a system where you can encrypt something without knowing the decryption key.
